meanings.sent1: I need to reassess my budget to make sure I have enough money.
meanings.sent2: After finishing the project, I will reassess the results to see if there are any errors.
meanings.sent3: Let's reassess the situation and see if we missed any important details.
meanings.sent4: She decided to reassess her goals and make necessary adjustments.
meanings.sent5: It's important to reassess our progress regularly to stay on track.

meanings.definition: To consider or think about something again.
meanings.sent1: I will reassess my decision before making any final choices.
meanings.sent2: Before making a purchase, it's wise to reassess if you really need it.
meanings.sent3: Let's reassess our plan and see if there's a better way to approach it.
meanings.sent4: She had to reassess her opinion after hearing new information.
meanings.sent5: Take a moment to reassess your priorities and focus on what truly matters.
